poem:
Black Britain, 1979-1990

Under Thatcher's shadow,  
voices rise—  
in streets bound tight  
with history.  
Silent ink  
on pages loud:  
We Were There.  
Unseen stars,  
mapping stories,  
stitching time  
into the fabric  
of mornings.  
Footfalls echo—  
an unwritten song  
carved into  
the heart's landscape.  
Voices bloom  
through time's quiet  
curtain.
